title: Silvergate Bank Resolves Wire Transfer Issue That Kept Transactions in Limbo
summary: Crypto-friendly Silvergate Bank resolved the last of its wire transfer issues Tuesday morning, said CEO Alan Lane.

title: The CFTC Just Defined What ‘Actual Delivery’ of Crypto Should Look Like
summary: The CFTC created formal guidance for when one party has “delivered” crypto assets to another, settling a long-standing question around the issue.

title: BitMEX Open Interest Collapses After Controversial Long Squeeze
summary: Open interest in XBT/USD on BitMEX has crashed by over 50 percent from 115,000 BTC to 55,000 BTC over the past 12 days.

title: Bitcoin and Gold: Evaluating Hard-Cap Currencies in Times of Financial Crisis
summary: How would a bitcoin economy react to coronavirus? For now, we don’t know. However, we can turn to a proxy for insight: gold.

title: Yale Researchers Turn to Hyperledger to Track Carbon Emissions
summary: A team from Yale's OpenLab has been exploring how blockchain, IoT and other data-science tools can be used to measure and track carbon emissions.

title: How to Contact CoinDesk’s Editors and Reporters (the Right Way)
summary: We've made it a lot easier to reach us. Our new masthead lists all CoinDesk reporters and editors, their beats and verified contact information.

title: Everledger Looks Beyond Blood Diamonds With ESG Supply Chain Collaboration
summary: Everledger, known for tracking diamonds on the blockchain, says the supply chain for batteries is where it will focus next.

title: Judge Halts Telegram Token Issuance in Injunction Requested by SEC
summary: A federal judge has granted the SEC’s preliminary injunction request, barring Telegram from issuing any gram tokens when it launches its blockchain network.

title: 8 US States Follow DHS in Naming ‘Blockchain Managers’ as Essential Employees in Coronavirus Crisis
summary: At least eight U.S. states have directed “blockchain managers” in food and agriculture to keep working through COVID-19 shutdowns following guidance from the Department of Homeland Security, though it remains unclear who this includes.

title: Stocks, Bitcoin Rally on Prospects for US Senate Stimulus Bill
summary: Financial markets rebounded Tuesday after prospects for a stimulus package out of the U.S. Senate improved. Most cryptocurrencies are gaining, too.

title: Cronyism, Zombie Companies and the True Cost of the Coronavirus, Feat. Morgan Creek’s Mark Yusko
summary: Why dependency culture, zombie corporations and debt jubilee could be the true cost of the coronavirus.

title: The Pandemic Gives Digital Currencies Another Chance to Shine
summary: Which digital currencies are most useful in a crisis, asks a Brazilian central banker. CBDCs, bitcoin or Libra?

title: Bitcoin News Roundup for March 24, 2020
summary: Will the US launch a digital dollar? And what happens to racers when they can't race? Find out on CoinDesk's Markets Daily podcast.

title: Russian Prime Minister Introduces Bill to Allow Fintech Sandboxes, Blockchain Included
summary: The new bill would allow the creation of “experimental regulatory regimes” for companies working on cutting-edge technologies like AI and distributed ledgers.

title: ‘Digital Dollar’ Stripped From Latest US Coronavirus Relief Bill
summary: The latest version of a U.S. House bill to stimulate the economy during the coronavirus pandemic no longer includes any language around a digital dollar, though a Financial Services Committee bill still does.
